intro: Pygeum longistylum, commonly known as the long-stemmed African dogwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded foliage and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is dispersed by wind. Its woody structure and adaptability to various soil types make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
